info.name: Fetch Source Codes
info.description:
# Purpose

The Classy API offers extensive functionality when trying to fetch data. This collection offers a starting point to explore how the API can be used to fetch source codes related to transactions, fundraising pages, and fundraising teams.

# How Do I Use This?

If you don't have experience with Postman, please take a look at their Getting Started documentation! [https://learning.postman.com/docs/getting-started/overview/](https://learning.postman.com/docs/getting-started/overview/)

This collection is meant to be a playground, allowing you to use either a Mock Server or your own Classy Account. You'll need to follow steps to get API credentials through Classy Manager: [https://support.classy.org/s/article/intro-to-the-classy-api](https://support.classy.org/s/article/intro-to-the-classy-api)

## Using the Mock Server

If you either don't have Classy credentials, or would prefer to not make these calls against your account, you can leverage a Mock Server we've put together as part of this collection. The mock server bases its responses on the Examples we've provided under each request, using a mixture of hard-coded data and faked data to mimic executing requests against the API. You can use this mock server to freely try out these requests. It doesn't perform any authentication, and functions outside the context of Postman. So you can try out these calls against the mock server using cURL, or the language of your choice, to try it out! To use the mock server, ensure you are using the Classy API Mock Server environment!

## Using the Classy API

If you are using your Classy Account, ensure you have your Client ID and Client Secret from Classy Manager. If you don't have these or don't know how to get them, you can find that information from this support article: [https://support.classy.org/s/article/intro-to-the-classy-api](https://support.classy.org/s/article/intro-to-the-classy-api)

Once you have these, ensure you are using the Classy API environment, and enter the Client ID and Client Secret into the 'current value' field for client_id and client_secret respectively.

Before making any of the requests to fetch source codes, you'll need to authenticate with the API. To do so, use the App Auth request under the Authentication folder. This will make a call to the API and, assuming you have working credentials, will provide a token that will be automatically saved and used for the other requests. These tokens have a limited timeframe in which they are valid, so if you start seeing errors that you have an invalid token, simply run the App Auth request again to get a new token.

Once you have this token, you should be able to make any requests in the Fetch Source Codes folder, by putting in existing IDs from records in your Classy account, and start to see the data you are looking for!

item.name: Authentication

exec: pm.test("Response time is less than 2000ms", function () {
pm.test("Access token is present in the response", function () {

request.description:
### POST /oauth2/auth

This endpoint is used to authenticate and obtain an access token.

#### Request Body
- `client_id` (string): The client ID for authentication.
- `client_secret` (string): The client secret for authentication.
- `grant_type` (string): The type of grant being requested.

#### Response
The response is a JSON object with the following properties:
- `access_token` (string): The access token obtained after successful authentication.
- `expires_in` (number): The duration in seconds for which the access token is valid.
- `queries_log` (array): An array of log entries for the queries made during the authentication process.
- `token_type` (string): The type of token being returned.

#### Example Response
```json
{
    "access_token": "",
    "expires_in": 0,
    "queries_log": [],
    "token_type": ""
}
```

#### JSON Schema
```json
{
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
        "access_token": {"type": "string"},
        "expires_in": {"type": "number"},
        "queries_log": {"type": "array"},
        "token_type": {"type": "string"}
    }
}

response.name: App Auth

item.description: This folder contains any requests that authenticate your credentials with the Classy API. Ensure you run this request to get a valid token before attempting to run other requests in this collection.

request.description:
### Get Transaction with Source Tracking Codes

This endpoint retrieves a specific transaction along with its source tracking codes.

#### Request

- Method: GET
- URL: `{{url}}/{{version}}/transactions/{{transaction_id}}?with=source_tracking_codes`
    

#### Response

Below is an example of the JSON response from this endpoint. For the most up to date reference of this, please refer to the documentation at [docs.classy.org](https://docs.classy.org)

#### Example

``` json
{
    "acknowledgements_count": 0,
    "adjustment_amount": 0,
    "applied_fot_percent": "",
    "billing_address1": "",
    "billing_address2": "",
    "billing_city": "",
    "billing_country": "",
    "billing_first_name": "",
    "billing_last_name": "",
    "billing_postal_code": "",
    "billing_state": "",
    "browser_info": "",
    "campaign_id": 0,
    "source_tracking_codes": [
        {
            "id": 0,
            "c_src": "",
            "c_src2": "",
            "referrer": "",
            "trackable_id": 0,
            "trackable_type": "",
            "event_type": "",
            "created_at": "",
            "updated_at": ""
        }
    ],
    ...
}

 ```

response.name: Success

request.description:
### Get Fundraising Team with Source Tracking Codes

This endpoint retrieves a specific fundraising team along with its source tracking codes.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{url}}/{{version}}/fundraising_teams/{{fundraising_team_id}}?with=source_tracking_codes`
    

#### Response

Below is an example of the JSON response from this endpoint. For the most up to date reference of this, please refer to the documentation at [docs.classy.org](https://docs.classy.org)

#### Example

``` json
{
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
        "campaign_id": {"type": "integer"},
        "canonical_url": {"type": "string"},
        "city": {"type": "string"},
        "country": {"type": "string"},
        "cover_photo_id": {"type": ["integer", "null"]},
        "cover_photo_url": {"type": ["string", "null"]},
        "created_at": {"type": "string"},
        "currency_code": {"type": "string"},
        "description": {"type": "string"},
        "designation_id": {"type": "integer"},
        "goal": {"type": "integer"},
        "id": {"type": "integer"},
        "logo_id": {"type": ["integer", "null"]},
        "logo_url": {"type": ["string", "null"]},
        "name": {"type": "string"},
        "organization_id": {"type": "integer"},
        "parent_id": {"type": ["integer", "null"]},
        "postal_code": {"type": ["string", "null"]},
        "raw_currency_code": {"type": "string"},
        "raw_goal": {"type": "string"},
        "root_id": {"type": ["integer", "null"]},
        "source_tracking_codes": {
            "type": "array",
            "items": {
                "type": "object",
                "properties": {
                    "id": {"type": "integer"},
                    "c_src": {"type": "string"},
                    "c_src2": {"type": "string"},
                    "referrer": {"type": "string"},
                    "trackable_id": {"type": "integer"},
                    "trackable_type": {"type": "string"},
                    "event_type": {"type": "string"},
                    "created_at": {"type": "string"},
                    "updated_at": {"type": "string"}
                }
            }
        },
        "state": {"type": "string"},
        "status": {"type": "string"},
        "team_lead_id": {"type": "integer"},
        "team_lead_supporter_id": {"type": "integer"},
        "team_policy_id": {"type": "integer"},
        "thank_you_text": {"type": ["string", "null"]},
        "updated_at": {"type": "string"}
    }
}

 ```

response.name: Success

request.description:
### Get Fundraising Page with Source Tracking Codes

This endpoint retrieves a specific fundraising page along with its source tracking codes.

#### Request

- Method: GET
- URL: `{{url}}/{{version}}/fundraising-pages/{{fundraising_page_id}}?with=source_tracking_codes`
    

#### Response

Below is an example of the JSON response from this endpoint. For the most up to date reference of this, please refer to the documentation at [docs.classy.org](https://docs.classy.org)

#### Example

``` json
{
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "alias": {"type": "string"},
    "campaign_id": {"type": "integer"},
    "canonical_url": {"type": "string"},
    "commitment_id": {"type": ["integer", "null"]},
    "cover_photo_id": {"type": ["integer", "null"]},
    "created_at": {"type": "string"},
    "currency_code": {"type": "string"},
    "designation_id": {"type": "integer"},
    "ended_at": {"type": "string"},
    "fundraising_team_id": {"type": "integer"},
    "goal": {"type": "integer"},
    "id": {"type": "integer"},
    "intro_text": {"type": "string"},
    "is_tribute": {"type": ["boolean", "null"]},
    "logo_id": {"type": ["integer", "null"]},
    "logo_url": {"type": ["string", "null"]},
    "member_email_text": {"type": ["string", "null"]},
    "member_id": {"type": "integer"},
    "organization_id": {"type": "integer"},
    "raw_currency_code": {"type": "string"},
    "raw_goal": {"type": "string"},
    "source_tracking_codes": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "id": {"type": "integer"},
          "c_src": {"type": "string"},
          "c_src2": {"type": "string"},
          "referrer": {"type": "string"},
          "trackable_id": {"type": "integer"},
          "trackable_type": {"type": "string"},
          "event_type": {"type": "string"},
          "created_at": {"type": "string"},
          "updated_at": {"type": "string"}
        }
      }
    },
    "started_at": {"type": "string"},
    "status": {"type": "string"},
    "supporter_id": {"type": "integer"},
    "team_role": {"type": "string"},
    "thank_you_text": {"type": "string"},
    "thankyou_email_text": {"type": ["string", "null"]},
    "title": {"type": "string"},
    "updated_at": {"type": "string"}
  }
}

 ```

response.name: Success

item.description: This folder contains all requests that allow you to get source codes for transactions, fundraising teams, or fundraising pages. Ensure you have run an Authentication request to have a valid token before trying to run any of these!
